b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:30): really useful indeed
73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:30): at least URIs of infinite length are ruled out :)
73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:31): I find file:// URLs the most annoying, personally
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:32): finds most URLs annoying
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:32): tries not to deal with them
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:32): Actually, I rather like data: URIs except that it should be made more clear what # does

73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:33): amazing edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e's head has not yet exploded :)
73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:34): (I quite agree though, URLs suck)
cca12426720dd35feb0521f16dfc3050 (14:34): URLs suck?
73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:35): suck == poorly specified
73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:35): not UNICODE-aware
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:36): they are sort of UNICODE aware
73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:36): and stupid syntax
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:36): but the specs don't match the implementations
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:36): it's a big mess
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:36): and the people who once made it all happen don't clean it up
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:37): (see also HTTP, CSS, DOM, XML and several other specs)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:37): well, CSS is still being cleaned up
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:37): to be fair
73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:37): I still find it amazing sometimes, that the fundamental tech. of our time is so poorly worked out
73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:38): XML is fairly clean these days, if you ignore its dependencies on URLs
73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:40): (XML not including XSD schema).
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:40): and not including DTDs?
73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:41): well, DTDs are *clean*, they're just *lame*
73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:42): but the spec defines what to do with them
73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:42): arguably parameter entities could be specified in a more thorough manner
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:43): yeah, fair enough
73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:43): obviously an XML 2.0 could make some improvements, but at least the XML 1.0 spec agrees with reality.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:44): not with character encoding and non well-formedness on mobile content and such
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:45): and feeds
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:45): 73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642: the reality of how IDness is established doesn't always agree with specs
73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:45): feeds are not XML
73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:45): that's more a problem with RSS specs than XML spec
73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642 (14:46): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, right, which kind of situations though?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:46): 73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642: DTDless XHTML for example

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:47): 73c8ec97fe210f482d81a5f04e5e6642: you want to have a filter somewhere that makes id an ID
